newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARIAN OVERNIGHT RATES END FIRMER, AT 20.25 PCT.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARIAN OVERNIGHT RATES END FIRMER, AT 20.25 PCT.

text.p: Hungarian overnight rates finished firmer, at 20.25 percent on Monday, up from Friday's close of 19.25 percent as the market started a new reserve period, dealers said.
Most deals were made at between 20 and 20.25 percent, althought there were some deals at 20.375 percent as well.
Trading was as usual at the beginning of a reserve period, dealers said.
"Everything was as usual, namely that at the beginning of reserve period we move back to a normal, higher level," said Pal Szucs of Hypo-Bank Hungaria.
Hungarian banks regard the National Bank of Hungary's one-week reverse repo rate, now at 20 percent, as benchmark.
Szucs said trading was balanced in good liquidity on the market.
